title: Type Reference Guides
content:
I’ve got a copy of the Precision Type Reference Guide, Dan Solo’s book and some others. I’d like to add to the collection and have some questions. I’ve been looking to find a copy of the PLINC catalog. Someone is selling a vintage copy on eBay for $250. Is there any chance that House Industries would republish it? And Font Book sells for $100 in one place and $350 in another. Why is that?

 [‹ Politics, Typography, and PETS!](http://web.archive.org/web/20080106172810/http:/www.typophile.com/node/20879 "Go to previous forum topic") [The September issue of Galley Gab published ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080106172810/http:/www.typophile.com/node/36682 "Go to next forum topic")
author: BlueStreak

comments.content:
[FontBook](http://web.archive.org/web/20080106172810/http:/www.typophile.com/wiki/FontBook) is now in its Fourth edition and available only from FontShop. The one you see at Amazon is a probably a used copy of the older Third edition. No reason to pay that unless you want the very few fonts that aren’t included in the expanded revision.

\> Is there any chance that House Industries would republish it?

I don’t think there’s a very good chance of that at all. But they will be releasing the type soon in a very interesting way.

The PLINC book should not be priced that high. They’re all “vintage”!... Keep looking. I got mine last year for less than $40. There were a bunch of versions, so presumably the later ones have more in them.

Thanks for the answers.

And Crossgrove you got the deal of a lifetime on that PLINC book. The value seems to be escalating. I hunted online for awhile yesterday and the average asking price seems to be between $200 to $300. But check out the [Biblio.com listing](http://web.archive.org/web/20080106172810/http:/www.biblio.com/details.php?dcx=118764189&aid=frg).

I also came across this great list, [Bowfin Printworks Typographic References](http://web.archive.org/web/20080106172810/http:/www.bowfinprintworks.com/ListPages/FontBookList.html).

\>But they will be releasing the type soon in a very interesting way.

This way? [http://typographica.org/000967.php](http://web.archive.org/web/20080106172810/http:/typographica.org/000967.php "http://typographica.org/000967.php") Or have they spent the last three years working out an alternate way to sell fonts?
BlueStreak, try [BookFinder.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20080106172810/http:/www.bookfinder.com/)... You may find a better deal there.
